Ahuja, Mona R wrote:

> I need to mock the Connection object of the java.sql package.  For this 
> I  used the com.mockobjects.sql.Connection2 mockobject.
> Now the problem is , i have to make the rollback method of the mocked 
> connection to throw an exception. Is there any way I can do that.I dont 
> have the source code for com.mockobjects.sql.Connection2

It might be easier just to use jMock or EasyMock for this one test. For 
example, the EasyMock code would look something like this.

connectionControl = MockControl.for(Connection.class);
connection = (Connection) connectionControl.getMock();

...

connection.rollback();    // "record" method invocation
connectionControl.setThrowable(new Exception("Your exception here")); 
  // "record" your response

...

// use the connection

...

connectionControl.verify();    // verifies that connection.rollback() 
was invoked

I have a question, though: how do you plan to handle 
Connection.rollback() throwing an exception? Usually that's a scenario 
that an application cannot do anything about.
